docs.lead_paragraph: The Los Angeles Film Festival, which runs June 18-28 this year, will feature the world premiere of "Public Enemies," one of the more hotly anticipated summer films. Michael Mann directs Johnny Depp as Depression era outlaw John Dillinger opposite Christian Bale as super G-man Melvin Purvis, Billy Crudup as J. Edgar Hoover, Channing Tatum as Pretty Boy Floyd and Stephen Graham as Baby Face Nelson. The film opens in U.S. theaters on July 1.

docs.snippet: New on the paperback list is “Empowered,” a series whose creator describes as a “sexy superhero comedy.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: The latest deluxe volume of Starman, the DC Comics series about Jack Knight, who inherits the role of his superhero father, arrives on the hardcover list at No. 2. This collection of stories includes a sequence in which Jack risks his life to save the villainous Solomon Grundy, a swamp creature that battled many of his father’s compatriots in the Justice Society of America. The writer, James Robinson, really makes you feel for the monster.
docs.abstract: New on the paperback list is “Empowered,” a series whose creator describes as a “sexy superhero comedy.”
